**Distance Cylinder**

The distance cylinder keeps the external tools and the hot channels apart at the opening and closing of the tools.

**Tightness**

The big area of the vertical force cylinder activates at low pressure, about 9 bar, to tighten between the hot channel and the tools.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000193313.png)

**Injection**

The injection cylinders activate and inject plastic into the cavity. There are sensors for full and empty cylinder.

**Pressing**

When the injection cylinder is empty the sensors activate pressing e.g. the big area and high pressure on the vertical cylinder. The pressure is controlled by a proportional valve.

The plastic cools down and pressing is done. Tightness releases and the horizontal force cylinder releases. The lock opens and the external tools open.

**Reference Cylinders**

The reference cylinders open the cavity at the injection. The reference cylinders are activated when the first lids are produced at start up. During a safety stop the length of the cylinder can be set when the cylinder is in deactivated position.

### Alarm 110303331/11030332 “No Granulate”

**Description**

Granulate is used to make lids in the machine. It is transported into the **LFU** by the [Granulate pipe](#GranulatePipegranulatePipe-DD98AFED). The [Capacitive sensor](#CapacitiveSensorcapacitiveSensor-DD98A927) checks if there is granulate in the [Granulate pipe](#GranulatePipegranulatePipe-DD98AFED). The sensors are adjustable for both position and sensitivity.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if the [Capacitive sensor](#CapacitiveSensorcapacitiveSensor-DD98A927) gives no signal.

1.  Side 1 stops feeding in new packaging material.
    
2.  Side 1 continues production and uses up the remaining packaging material on that side of the machine.
    
3.  Side 1 steps down to MOTOR RUNNING.
    
4.  After 10 minutes, side 1 steps down to TANK FILLING.
    
5.  Side 2 stays in production.
    

1.  Side 2 stops feeding in new packaging material.
    
2.  Side 2 continues production and uses up the remaining packaging material on that side of the machine.
    
3.  Side 2 steps down to MOTOR RUNNING.
    
4.  After 10 minutes, side 2 steps down to TANK FILLING.
    
5.  Side 1 stays in production.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000193462.png)

*   Capacitive sensor
*   Granulate pipe

**Troubleshooting**

*   Incorrect angle of the granulate pipes leading into the transfer unit. Check and adjust the hose and piping between the hopper and the metering device according to:
    
    1.  [Metering Device - Install](#section840)
        
*   Faulty or incorrectly set capacitive sensor on the granulate pipe leading into the transfer unit. Correct according to:
    
    1.  [Metering Device - Set](#section838)
        
*   Plastic residue is stuck in the pipe before the transfer unit, caused by an incorrect setting of the valves in the granulate container. Set according to:
    
    1.  Installation Manual 4.6.3.4 Setting of the Granulate Velocity
        

### Alarm 110303510/110303520/110703520/110703530 "Granulate Hopper MB/PE, Feeding Fault"

**Description**

The granulate hopper receives granulate from the **GSU** and supplies the transfer unit in **S1** and **S2** with **PE** and **MB**.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if the [Proximity switch](#ProximitySwitchproximitySwitch-DD99434E) is active longer than the time set in the PLC.

When the alarm 110303510/110303520/110703520/110703530 appears, both sides steps to PRODUCTION END. When the sides are empty the machine steps down to HEATING.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000193461.png)

*   Proximity switch

**Troubleshooting**

*   No granulate in the granulate container. Check the granulate level in the granulate container.
    
*   Incorrect detection of the hatch position. Change according to:
    
    [Granulate Hopper - Set Proximity Switch](#section1713)
    
    [Granulate Hopper - Change Hatch Gasket](#section1715)
    

### Alarm 110303361/110303381/110303401/110303362/110303382/110303402 "Transfer Unit Too Long Heating Time"

**Description**

The transfer unit transports the granulate from the granulate pipe to the plastic accumulator while melting and mixing the plastic. The transfer unit has heating elements to melt the plastic.

Temperature sensors are placed in three zones on the transfer unit. The operating temperature of the transfer unit must be reached with the time set in the **PLC**.

A signal is sent from the temperature sensors if the operating temperature is reached within the set time.

This alarm can only occur within the first 30 minutes after the machine steps to program step HEATING. If the operating temperature is reached within the first 30 minutes after the machine steps to program step HEATING the alarm can not occur.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if the operating temperature was not reached within the time set in **PLC**.

1.  Side 1 stops feeding in new packaging material.
    
2.  Side 1 continues production and uses up the remaining packaging material on that side of the machine.
    
3.  Side 1 steps down to MOTOR RUNNING.
    
4.  After 10 minutes, side 1 steps down to TANK FILLING.
    
5.  Side 2 stays in production.
    

1.  Side 2 stops feeding in new packaging material.
    
2.  Side 2 continues production and uses up the remaining packaging material on that side of the machine.
    
3.  Side 2 steps down to MOTOR RUNNING.
    
4.  After 10 minutes, side 2 steps down to TANK FILLING.
    
5.  Side 1 stays in production.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000193460.png)

*   Zone 1 - S1 110303361, S2 110303362
*   Zone 2 - S1 110303381, S2 110303382
*   Zone 3 - S1 110313401, S2 110303402

**Troubleshooting**

*   Check that the temperature rises and falls back to the set value within 5 minutes in step HEATING.
    
*   Defective heating element. Check according to:
    
    [Transfer Unit - Check](#section826)
    
*   Check the measuring point connection to the measuring object.
    
*   Check the fuses and the solid state relay according to:
    
    EM

### Alarm 110303461/110303462 “Tools Not Completely Opened”

**Description**

The servomotor starts to open the external tools when the injection and pressing is complete and the horizontal lock is open. The oil in the vertical cylinder is forced back into the accumulator.

When the external tools are completely open the vertical force cylinder is in its bottom position and the [Proximity switch](#ProximitySwitchproximitySwitch-DE2E5BED) activates.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if the tools are not opened within the sector value range 1550 - 1590.

When this alarm appears the machine performs a quick stop and steps down to heating.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000193895.png)

*   Proximity switch

**Troubleshooting**

*   Incorrectly set proximity switch.
    
    Set according to:
    
    [Guide Hot Channel - Set Inductive Switch](#section817)
    
*   Incorrect accumulator pressure.
    
    Check hydraulic pressure and air pressure according to:
    
    [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895)
    
*   The scissor movement is too slow.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Pressing Unit - Check Spacer and Cylinder](#section787)
    
*   Clogged flow restrictor.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Flow Restrictor - Check](#section898)
    
*   Slow reaction of logic valve.
    
    Change valve S1/A30K1224, S2/A30K2224 according to:
    
    [Directional Valve - Change](#section910)
    
*   Faulty drive belt.
    
    Change according to:
    
    [Drive Tool - Change Belts](#section844)
    
*   Incorrect timing belt tension.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Drive Tool - Set Belt Tension](#section843)
    

*   Slow or no response from the directional valve S1/A30K1228, S2/A30K2228.
    
    Check with logger and change valve S1/A30K1228, S2/A30K2228 according to:
    
    [Directional Valve - Change](#section908)
    
*   Faulty feedback cable.
    
    Change the cable temporarily and test.
    
*   The gear box is slipping.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Motor Unit - Check Belt](#section849)
    
    [Motor Unit - Overhaul](#section854)
    
*   Air in horizontal cylinder
    
    Perform a bleeding according to:
    
    [Hydraulic System LFU - Bleed](#section911)
    
    If bleeding is required frequently, the reason can be air leakage through an invisible hole in the cylinder hydraulic hose. Check or change the affected hydraulic hose and perform a new bleeding.
    

### Alarm 110303471/110303472 “Tools Not Closed, Injection Cycle Interrupted”

**Description**

The servomotor pulls the belts that close the external tools.

    Set the homing position according to:
    
    [LFU - Set Homing Position](#section743)
    
*   The scissor movement is too slow.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Pressing Unit - Check Spacer and Cylinder](#section787)
    
*   The scissor is not centred.
    
    Centre the scissor according to:
    
    [Pressing Unit - Check Spacer and Cylinder](#section787)
    
*   Incorrectly adjusted proximity switch.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Pressing Unit - Set Inductive Switch](#section786)
    
*   Incorrect pressure in the accumulator.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895)
    
*   Air in the horizontal cylinder.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Hydraulic System LFU - Change Hydraulic Hoses](#section907)
    
*   Incorrectly centred timing belt.
    
    Check and adjust according to:
    
    [Drive Tool - Set Belt Tension](#section843)
    
*   Faulty feedback cable.
    
    Change the cable temporarily and test.
    
*   Internal leakage or mechanical fault in the vertical cylinder.
    
    Check for pressure leaks in the accumulator:
    
    [Valve Ramp Unit - Check](#section893)
    
*   The pneumatic non return valve is leaking.
    
    Change the pneumatic non return valve according to:

### Alarm 110303481/110303491/110303482/110303492 "Injection Cylinder Not Filled"

**Description**

To perform an injection, the hot channel must have a full dosage of plastic within the sector value range 220-270.

When the hot channel is filled the front [Inductive switch](#InductiveSwitchinductiveSwitch-E044FF2E) is activated and the injection begins.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if there is no signal from the front [Inductive switch](#InductiveSwitchinductiveSwitch-E044FF2E) to the **PLC** within the sector value range 220-270.

When this alarm appears the machine performs a Controlled Quick Stop and steps down to program step heating.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000194251.png)

*   Inductive switch

**Troubleshooting**

*   No granulate.
    
    Check granulate supply into the transfer unit.
    
*   Plastic stuck in the inlet.
    
    Clean the inlet to the transfer unit.
    
*   Incorrectly set proximity switch on the injection cylinder.
    
    Adjust the transmitter according to:
    
    \- [Hot Channel - Basic Set of Plastic Dosing](#section803)
    
*   Incorrect air pressure in the plastic accumulator.
    
    Adjust according to:
    
    \- [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895)
    
*   Incorrect frequency on the transfer unit.
    
    Check and adjust according to:
    
    \- [Transfer Unit - Set Frequency](#section827)
    
*   The piston on the plastic side has seized.
    
    Check according to:
    
    \- [Hot Channel - Overhaul Injection Cylinder](#section809)
    
*   The piston on the plastic accumulator has seized.
    
    Check the clearance and stroke on the accumulator position.
    
*   Leakage in heating hose.
    
    Check and adjust according to:
    
    \- [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895)
    
    \- [Transfer Unit - Set Frequency](#section827)
    

### Alarm 110303621/110303631/110303622/110303632 "Too Long Injection Time, Injection Not Completed"

**Description**

The [Inductive switch](#InductiveSwitchinductiveSwitch-E0454D5E) is active when the injection cycle is completed and the injection cylinder is empty of plastic. The injection cycle begins at the sector value range 340 - 390.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if the injection is not complete within the selected sector value range, see table.

Base

630-730

Midi

600-700

Mini

600-700

Micro

600-700

When this alarm appears the machine performs a Controlled Quick Stop and steps down to program step heating.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000195184.png)

*   Inductive switch

**Waste 110035041/110035042 - Waste in LFU**

The first pair of packages after an empty carton section is aborted empty, if the time for injection is passing the limits for the alarm of “Too long injection time, injection not completed” to avoid stopping the machine. If the injection time during the first shot is passing sector 800 it will give a yellow alarm for “Too long injection time, injection not completed”.

**Troubleshooting**

*   Plastic is stuck in the tools.
    
    Clean according to:
    
    \- OM
    
*   Plastic residue behind the injection cylinder.
    
    Clean according to:
    
    \- OM
    
*   Air in the injection cylinder.
    
    Perform bleeding according to:
    
    \- [Hydraulic System LFU - Bleed](#section911)
    
*   Incorrect hydraulic pressure.
    
    Set pressure according to:
    
    \- [Injection Pressure - Set](#section902)
    
*   Slow valve.
    
    Change valve S1/A30K1227, S2/A30K2227 according to:
    
    \- [Directional Valve - Change](#section910)
    
*   The injection cylinder has seized.
    
    Change injection cylinder according to:
    
    \- [Hot Channel - Overhaul Injection Cylinder](#section809)
    

### Alarm 110303501/110303502 "Mandrel Wheel Error"

**Description**

Each mandrel wheel is driven by a [Servomotor](#ServoMotorservoMotor-E0458F99) through a planetary gear.

The servomotor works as overload protection and controls the mandrel wheel indexing movement.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm occurs due to a position fault or resolver function error.

The position fault can be due to overload or interrupted movement.

When this alarm appears the machine performs a quick stop and steps down to heating.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000195182.png)

*   Servomotor

**Troubleshooting**

*   Internal error in the servo drive.
    
    Check error code on the servo drive according to:
    
    [Servo System Troubleshooting](#section1862)
    
*   The clamp is touching the mandrel wheel.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [LFU - Basic Set](#section741)
    
*   Feedback error.
    
    Change the cable temporarily and test
    
*   Sequential error on unopened tools.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Alarm 110303461/110303462 “Tools Not Completely Opened”](#section714)
    

### Alarm 110303641/110303642 “Feeder Motor Overload”

**Description**

The feeder motor drives the transfer unit screw at different speeds.

The speed is controlled by the level switches on the accumulator. A low level gives high speed.

If high speed is on for more than 30 seconds the motor stops to avoid plastic leakage and to avoid that any part in the system breaks.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if the plastic accumulator [Inductive switch](#InductiveSwitchinductiveSwitch-E045D14D) has been active for more than 30 seconds in the steps motor running, Production or Production End.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000195181.png)

*   Inductive switch

**Troubleshooting**

*   The transfer unit screw has run more than 30 seconds at high speed.
    
    Check that there is granulate coming into the transfer unit.
    
*   Plastic stuck in the inlet to the transfer unit.
    
    Clean according to:
    
    \- OM
    
*   Faulty accumulator location transmitter (position or function).
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Transfer Unit - Set Frequency](#section827)
    
*   Leaking system, most likely a heating hose.
    
    Repair the leak.
    
*   Incorrectly set frequency converter.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Transfer Unit - Set Frequency](#section827)
    

### Alarm 110303661/110303662 “Hydraulic Accumulator Wrong Pressure”

**Description**

The hydraulic accumulator supports the servomotor in the tool movement.

The air pressure in the accumulator is recharged over a non-return valve by pneumatic air to 2.8-3.0bar and then by hydraulic oil, recharged to 13bar.

The accumulator air pressure varies during the cycle due to the volume change of oil in the accumulator, open or closed tools.

In the cycle, when tools are opened, the recharge valve opens for a short time to obtain the pressure balance between the pneumatic air and the hydraulic oil in the accumulator. This is to compensate the bleeding.

Bleeding is always on to avoid overfilling of oil due to the position change of the logic element.

To detect a hydraulic overload by oil volume, the hydraulic pressure is supervised by the [Pressure switch](#PressureSwitchpressureSwitch-10FA8BB0). With the tools closed, the accumulator unit is almost empty of oil. The hydraulic pressure is then normally 2-3bar.

**Conditions to Set the Alarm**

The alarm will be set if there is a higher hydraulic pressure than 8bar in the accumulation unit during pressing at the sector value 500-1000. The normal value is 2 bar to 3bar.

When this alarm appears, the machine performs an Empty Package Stop and steps down to Heating.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002067301.png)

*   Pressure switch

**Troubleshooting**

*   Clogged flow restrictor.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Flow Restrictor - Check](#section898)
    
*   Internal leaks in the vertical cylinder.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Vertical Cylinder - Check](#section896)
    
*   Faulty accumulator pressure.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895)
    
*   Faulty check-valve.
    
    Change check-valve according to:
    
    [Accumulator Unit - Change Check-valve](#section900)
    
*   Faulty non-return valve after the tightness valve.
    
    Check according to:
    
    [Valve Ramp Unit - Check Valve Ramp](#section899)
    

### Alarm (blue) 110303691/110303692 “High Torque/Position Error”

**Description**

The [Servomotor](#ServoMotorservoMotor-E0464A80) handles the opening and closing of the external tools together with the vertical force cylinder.

The [Servomotor](#ServoMotorservoMotor-E0464A80) drives a [Belt](#Beltbelt-E046539E) that is connected to a [Shaft](#Shaftshaft-E0465844). The [Shaft](#Shaftshaft-E0465844) has [Toothed pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulleys-E04664FC) where the [Timing belt](#TimingBelttimingBelts-E0466C58) are attached.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000195219.png)

*   Servomotor
*   Belt
*   Shaft

*   Toothed pulley
*   Timing belt

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The blue alarm will be set if the torque is high or if the servomotor position is faulty. The alarm will only be set between sector values 1-200 and 1350-1530.

The blue alarm will be set if the position fault is 0.050 or more. The alarm will also be set if the position fault is 0.025 or more during the homing sequence.

    Check according to:

*   Faulty check-valve.
    
    Change check-valve according to:
    
    [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895) on page [Accumulator Unit - Check Pressure](#section895)
    
*   Faulty pneumatic non-return valve.
    
    Check according to:

### Alarm 110303341/110303342 "Tool Movement Error"

**Description**

The [Servomotor](#Servomotorservomotor-F7DFC1A9) handles the opening and closing of the external tools together with the vertical force cylinder.

During the opening cycle the oil in the vertical cylinder is forced back into the accumulator.

During the closing cycle the oil in the accumulator is forced back to the vertical cylinder by the air pressure in the top of the accumulator.

**Conditions to set the alarm**

The alarm will be set if a position fault is detected due to overload/obstruction or feedback error.

When this alarm appear the motors stop immediately and the machine steps to pre-heating.

PE drop at LS inside of a Tetra Top package
-------------------------------------------

Important information about the PE drop at the LS
-------------------------------------------------

### Background

The PE drop at LS (plastic flash) that can be seen inside the package is a natural part of the Tetra Top package design. The drop is caused by tolerances and safety precautions that are set so that the packaging material is not punctured when double material gets squeezed between the outer and inner tools.

The input for the safety margins (LS compensation in tool) is:

*   The tolerance of the material web reel
    
*   The sleeve tolerance when sealing
    
*   The sleeve rotation when putting the sleeve into position for lid forming
    

The tools are designed to compensate for all the tolerances and ensure that the packaging material is not punctured.

Due to the fact that LS overlap will vary from reel to reel the LS clearance for the tool has to be large enough for the largest LS without puncturing the sleeve. The PE drop is caused when the LS width on the sleeve is smaller than the LS clearance.

### Size of the PE drop

Because of the huge variety of the different top designs and sizes it is impossible to say what size and appearance the PE drop must have. As long as the machine can strip the package from the mandrels the PE drop is small enough.

The PE drop is needed to produce safe packages with maintained package integrity. As long as the packages pass the destructive and blue ink package integrity checks according to OM – Package Check, the PE drop is large enough.

### Factors that influence the PE drop size

### Lid Thickness

The lid thickness depends on the plastic dosing and pressing pressure. Increasing the plastic dosing without changing the pressing pressure will result in a thicker lid. Decreasing the plastic dosing without changing the pressing pressure it will result in a thinner lid.

The plastic dosing together with the pressing pressure also affects the shape and size of the PE drop.

By increasing or decreasing the plastic dosing and at the same time increasing or decreasing the pressing pressure the shape and size of the PE drop and the lid thickness will change.

**Note:** Going outside of the specified limits of lid thickness will create problems with integrity, capping, heat and stability.

### Package material

The width of the reel can differ from reel to reel, while staying within the tolerance of the packaging material. This makes the LS overlap slightly larger or smaller. A smaller LS overlap creates a bigger PE drop.

### Pressing pressure on LFU

The pressing pressure is used to press the plastic into the moulding tool cavity. A higher pressing pressure can make the PE drop larger, and a lower pressure can make it smaller. The values in the MM are default values and can be adjusted in order to optimise the performance. Approximately a ±10% change can be used if all other settings are OK and the package functionality is OK.

**Note:** The pressing pressure will directly affect the lid thickness. A smaller pressing pressure will make the lid thicker but also increase the risk of the plastic does not cover the sleeve completely or holes in the lid.

### Sleeve top circumference

The sleeve top circumference affects the LS overlap which then affects the plastic flash. A smaller sleeve top circumference causes a bigger LS overlap and a smaller PE drop.

**Note:** An incorrect sleeve size will seriously affect the package integrity and performance of the machine.

### Mechanical setting of LFU and tools

Incorrect mechanical settings can influence the PE drop in both directions. LFU and tools must be set according to the MM.

Position of the PE drop
-----------------------

Factors that influence the PE drop position
-------------------------------------------

### Crease position

The crease position set by the operator directly affects the position of the PE drop. If the crease is moved to the left in the ASU the PE drop will move to the left side of the LS as seen from the inside of the package.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000861549.png)

**Note:** The positioning of the crease is something the operator check and change often due to the factory creasing position on the package material. There is only one setting for this and that is in the centre of the K crease in the bottom of the package. If this is out of position it will affect the bottom and flap sealing of the package.

### Sleeve rotation on the mandrel

The sleeve rotation on the mandrel will affect the position of the PE drop. There is only one setting for this and that is that the crease on the sleeve must be aligned with the centre of the outer moulding tools.

**Note:** If the sleeve position on the mandrel is incorrect, a basic setting of the erector unit is needed.

LFU

### LFU - Set Basic Alignment

Equipment Status

Program Step

Special Equipment

Ruler, TP No. 2678694  
Template vertical guide, TP No. 2787510  
Deep Gauge, TP No. 2760316 or  
Deep Gauge, TP No. 3424768

Risk of injury

Be careful when working near the shims.

The shims in the LFU could be sharp.

Risk of crushing

Be careful when working near the moving parts. It is recommended to use trained personnel when working with the **LFU** unit in service position. Enclose the area around the LFU and make sure that no unauthorized personnel can come in contact with the LFU.

The machine contains moving parts that can crush.

#### Preparation

1.  Roll out the LFU, see Procedure [LFU - Move to Service Position](#section744).
    
    The rulers must be assembled on the docking side of the **LFU**. All illustrations show the docking side of the LFU on S1.
    
2.  Remove the [Mandrel wheel](#MandrelWheelmandrelWheel-AAD9F4E9), see Procedure [Mandrel Wheel - Remove](#section758).

#### Positioning

In the front of and the side of the frame (see arrows in illustration) there are engraved figures. The figures come from a check of the frame against the drawing specification.

A deviation from the nominal measure at each measuring point, results in an engraved figure in the frame. If the measuring spot is on the nominal value, the engraving is **0**.

**When to use**

To set the vertical guide to a correct position, the bars must be set to the nominal value against the measuring surfaces. The value that is measured must be compensated with the marked deviation when setting the vertical guide. The engraved marking is the deviation from ±0 and is a factory set value.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004296192.png)

1.  Measure the distances **A, B, C,** and **D** with a [Deep gauge](#DeepGaugedeepGauge-A01108F2).
    
    Engraved values on the frame can be specified in two different ways, for example: -16 or -0.16: Both values mean -0.16 mm.
    
    Negative engraved values mean the surface on the frame is below nominal value.
    
    Positive engraved values mean the surface on the frame is above nominal value.
    
2.  Compensation: Measured setting value should be compensated with the engraved value.
    
    *   **Example no. 1:** Engraved -0.16 must be added as 0.16 to the measured value.
        
    *   **Example no. 2:** Engraved 0.10 must reduce the measured value by 0.10.
        

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004296191.png)

Views from above

*   Deep gauge
*   Ruler

**Note:** Use the template in Section to fill in the measured values.

4.  Measure B upper. Add or reduce the engraved value.
    
5.  Measure B lower. Add or reduce the engraved value.
    
    *   The difference between the compensated values B upper and B lower should be within tolerance ±0.05, to make mechanism vertical.
        
6.  Measure A lower. Add or reduce the engraved value.
    
7.  Measure C lower. Add or reduce the engraved value.
    
    *   The difference between the compensated values A lower and C lower should be within tolerance ±0.05, to make mechanism parallel to the mandrel shaft.
        
8.  Measure D front upper. Add or reduce the engraved value.
    
9.  Measure D front lower. Add or reduce the engraved value.
    
    *   The difference between the compensated values D front upper and D front lower should be within tolerance ±0.05, to make mechanism vertical.

#### Assembly

1.  Remove the rulers with brackets.
    
2.  At this point the rings should be sliding easily down, when lifted, without any force added in any direction.
    
3.  Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-AAD9F4E9) and the [Screw](#Screwscrews-1225223-AAD9F4E9) with the correct torque.
    
4.  At this point the rings should be sliding easily down, when lifted, without any force added in any direction.
    
5.  Remove the template.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004296190.png)

*   Screw
*   Screw

6.  Fit the [Bearing Half](#BearingHalfbearingHalves-AAD9F4E9), the [Shim](#Shimshims-AAD9F4E9), the [Steel washer](#SteelWashersteelWashers-E03C63BD), and the [Bronze washer](#BronzeWasherbronzeWashers-E03C6E7D).
    
    **Note:** Notice on which side the [Shim](#Shimshims-AAD9F4E9) are situated, do not mix between the sides. Change all damaged [Shim](#Shimshims-AAD9F4E9).
    
    **Note:** Place the thickest [Shim](#Shimshims-AAD9F4E9) on top and the thinnest [Shim](#Shimshims-AAD9F4E9) in the middle.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004296189.png)

*   Bearing Half
*   Shim
*   Steel washer
*   Bronze washer

7.  Assemble the mandrel wheel, see Procedure [Mandrel Wheel - Assemble](#section762).
    
8.  Set the tools, see Procedure [External Tools - Set Centre of Tools](#section872).
    
9.  If no basic set is performed or registrated, perform a basic set. See Procedure [LFU - Basic Set](#section741).
    
10.  Set the support to reference stop, see Procedure [LFU - Set Support to Reference Stop](#section742).
    
11.  Install the LFU, see Procedure [LFU - Install from Service Position](#section746).

Risk of injury

Be careful when working near the shims.

The shims in the LFU could be sharp.

Oil under pressure.

Use protective goggles when working near and around the **LFU** unit. Check the condition of the hydraulic hoses and connections before setting the machine into service mode. If necessary, change the hoses. See Procedure [Hydraulic System LFU - Change Hydraulic Hoses](#section907).

Risk of eye injury.

Risk of crushing.

Be careful when working near the moving parts. Use trained personnel when working with the **LFU** unit in service position.

The machine contains moving parts that can crush.

#### Foreword

It is important that the **LFU** is in range for its working temperature (heating) during the whole performance of the basic setting. Otherwise, the performed checks and settings are not reliable.

**Note:** Before a decision is taken to perform the basic setting, check the pressures according to the list:

*   **Bleed**
    
    If the LFU hydraulic system has been opened, bleed. See Procedure [Hydraulic System LFU - Bleed](#section911).
    
*   **Accumulator Air Pressure**
    
    Check and if necessary, set the accumulator air pressure. See Procedure [Pneumatic Pressures LFU - Set](#section917).
    
*   **Accumulator Hydraulic Pressure**
    
    Check and if necessary, set the accumulator hydraulic pressure. See Procedure [Hydraulic Accumulator Pressure - Set](#section901).
    
*   **Injection Cylinders and Horizontal Cylinders**
    
    *   Check and if necessary, set the injection pressure. See Procedure [Injection Pressure - Set](#section902).
        
    *   Check and if necessary, set the horizontal force pressure. See Procedure [Horizontal Force Pressure - Set](#section903).

#### Move the LFU to Service Position

Remove the **LFU**. See Procedure [LFU - Move to Service Position](#section744).

#### Check the Tightness Pressure

1.  Make sure that the machine is in heating.
    
2.  Turn a mandrel pair (with sleeves) downwards.
    
3.  Measure the tightness pressure **1.8 MPa (18 bar)** with a pressure gauge in the [Measuring point vertical cylinder](#MeasuringPointVerticalCylindermeasu-1799CC42).
    
4.  Use the remote control. See Procedure [LFU Remote Control - Handle](#section748). When the **LFU** is in working temperature, start:
    
    *   Step 1 Hydraulic High Pressure
        
    *   Step 2 Locking Scissors
        
    *   Close tools manually with the recharging valve on the hydraulic block.
        
    *   Step 3 Horizontal Force
        
    *   Step 4 Reference Cylinder
        
    *   Step 5 Tightness
        
5.  If necessary, adjust the tightness pressure on the [Tightness reduction valve](#TightnessReductionValvetightnessPre-1799D762).
    
6.  Deactivate in the reverse order.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002085885.png)

*   Tightness reduction valve
*   Measuring point vertical cylinder

#### Check Pressing Pressure

1.  Make sure that the machine is in heating.
    
2.  Turn a mandrel pair (with sleeves) downwards.
    
3.  Measure the pressing pressure with a pressure gauge in the [Measuring point vertical cylinder](#MeasuringPointVerticalCylindermeasu-489B8BF2).
    
    **Note:** The pressing pressure for the current opening is found in Procedure .
    
4.  Use the remote control. See Procedure [LFU Remote Control - Handle](#section748). When the **LFU** is in working temperature, start:
    
    *   Step 1 Hydraulic High Pressure
        
    *   Step 2 Locking Scissors
        
    *   Close tools manually with the recharging valve on the hydraulic block.
        
    *   Step 3 Horizontal Force
        
    *   Step 4 Reference Cylinder
        
    *   Step 5 Tightness
        
    *   Step 6 Pressing
        
5.  If necessary, adjust the [Adjusting Pressing Pressure](#AdjustingPressingPressurepressingPr-E0AAE292).
    
6.  Deactivate in the reverse order.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002085884.png)

*   Adjusting Pressing Pressure

*   Measuring point vertical cylinder

#### Adjust the Height of the Middle Bearing Half

1.  Make sure that the LFU is in Step 4 `reference cylinder`.
    
2.  Keep the [Measuring tool](#Beambeam-F3126B04) assembled during the setting.
    
3.  Loosen the [Screw](#Screwscrews-F3127053) for the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-F312759B) and the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-F3127A1C).

5.  **Valid for:** Barrier nut and flange nut
    
    Loosen the [Screw](#Screwscrews-F3F73522).
    
6.  Set the [Middle bearing half](#MiddleBearingHalfmiddleBearingHalf-F312817D) by loosening or tightening the [Flange nut](#FlangeNutflangeNut-F3F73523).

9.  Set the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-F312759B) and the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-F3127A1C). See Procedure-section [Set the Outer Bearing Halves](#SetTheOuterBearingHalves-F0338210).

11.  Set the [Middle bearing half](#MiddleBearingHalfmiddleBearingHalf-F312817D) by loosening or tightening the [Plate](#Plateplate-F3FCECA8).

#### Set the Outer Bearing Halves

1.  Make sure that the [Middle bearing half](#MiddleBearingHalfmiddleBearingHalf-EB9D5452) is adjusted.
    
2.  Make sure that the LFU is in Step 4 `reference cylinder`.
    
3.  Keep the [Measuring tool](#MeasuringToolmeasuringTool-EB9D592F) assembled during the setting.

5.  Adjust the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-EB36A7A7) according to the value obtained from Procedure Section [Check the Gap between Bearing Halves and Mandrel Shaft](#CheckTheGapBetweenBearingHalvesAndM-1F91BBD2). The raise on the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-EB36A7A7) must be **0.2**.
    
6.  To adjust up or down, tap gently with a rubber club either on the [Rod end](#RodEndrodEnds-EB9D82FC) or on the [Edge](#Edgeedge-EB9D8ABE) of the [Outer bearing half](#OuterBearingHalfouterBearingHalf-EB36A7A7).

### LFU - Set Support to Reference Stop

Equipment Status

Program Step

Special Equipment

Measuring Instrument, TP No. 1567930-0101

Risk of injury

Be careful when working near the shims.

The shims in the LFU could be sharp.

#### Check

1.  Set the mandrel wheel in a cross position so it is positioned away from the external tools.
    
    **Note:** The measuring point on the reference stop is on the side of the [Steel washer](#SteelWasherSteelWasher-E0C99531), front and rear.
    
2.  Activate step 3 (horizontal force) to close the external tools, see Procedure[LFU Remote Control - Handle](#section748).
    
3.  Mount the [Dial indicator](#DialIndicatorDialIndicator-E0C99DD5) at the measuring point.
    
4.  Activate step 5 (tightness).
    
5.  Set the [Dial indicator](#DialIndicatorDialIndicator-E0C99DD5) to zero.
    
6.  Activate step 4 (reference cylinder) and read the dial indicator.
    
    **Note:** Maximum sideways play must be reduced to less than 0.10 mm. If necessary, set the support.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000195230.png)

*   Steel washer
*   Dial indicator

#### Set

1.  Loosen the counter nuts on the [Adjusting screw](#AdjustingScrewscrew-E0C9CD5B).
    
2.  Loosen the [Vertical screw](#VerticalScrewverticalScrews-E0C9AF02).
    
3.  Adjust [Adjusting screw](#AdjustingScrewscrew-E0C9CD5B) and repeat item [Reference](ActivateStep5tightness.-065CB32F) and [Reference](ActivateStep4referenceCylinderAndRe-065CC7CE) until the correct value is reached.
    
4.  Tighten the [Vertical screw](#VerticalScrewverticalScrews-E0C9AF02) to **50 Nm**.
    
5.  Tighten the counter nuts.
    
6.  Repeat the check again.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000195229.png)

*   Vertical screw
*   Adjusting screw

Program Step

Special Equipment

Keyboard

Risk of damage to the equipment.

Make sure that the [Mandrel](#Mandrelmandrels-E0CAEC31) are aligned in a 90° position before setting the homing position.

3.  For tools with FIXED bushing, go to item [Reference](AlignTheManuallyInA90PositionWithTh-C8A6CD2A).

#### Description of the LFU steps

Table Text

Action when ACTIVATE is pressed

**Step 1**

Hydraulic high Pressure

The hydraulic unit will go up to high pressure.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251675.png)

High pressure

When Service S1 or S2 is chosen on the TPOP-menu.

\- The hydraulic unit will start on low pressure.

\- Distance cylinders for hot channel (2) and hanger (3) will be activated .

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251674.png)

Low pressure

**Step 2**

Locking scissors

The locking function for the horizontal cylinder (4) will be activated .

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251676.png)

Activate Manually

Risk of damage to the equipment.

Make sure that the mandrels are in a position where they cannot collide with the raising external tools.

If the mandrels are positioned in the wrong direction when the recharging accumulator valve is activated, the mandrels and the external tools can collide.

The tools can be activated manually by pressing the recharging accumulator valve between step 2 and 3.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251677.png)

**Step 3**

Horizontal Force

The horizontal cylinder (5) will be activated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251678.png)

**Step 4**

Reference Cylinder

The cylinder in reference stop (6) will be activated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251679.png)

**Step 5**

Tightness

The distance cylinder for hot channel (7) and the hanger (8) will be deactivated, tightness pressure (9) will be activated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251680.png)

**Step 6**

Pressing

The pressing pressure (11) will be activated, and the reference cylinder (10) will be deactivated.

#### Description of the LFU steps

Table Text

Action when ACTIVATE is pressed

**Step 1**

Hydraulic high Pressure

The hydraulic unit will go up to high pressure.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251675.png)

High pressure

When Service S1 or S2 is chosen on the TPOP-menu.

\- The hydraulic unit will start on low pressure.

\- Distance cylinders for hot channel (2) and hanger (3) will be activated .

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251674.png)

Low pressure

**Step 2**

Locking scissors

The locking function for the horizontal cylinder (4) will be activated .

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251676.png)

Activate Manually

Risk of damage to the equipment.

Make sure that the mandrels are in a position where they cannot collide with the raising external tools.

If the mandrels are positioned in the wrong direction when the recharging accumulator valve is activated, the mandrels and the external tools can collide.

The tools can be activated manually by pressing the recharging accumulator valve between step 2 and 3.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251677.png)

**Step 3**

Horizontal Force

The horizontal cylinder (5) will be activated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251678.png)

**Step 4**

Reference Cylinder

The cylinder in reference stop (6) will be activated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251679.png)

**Step 5**

Tightness

The distance cylinder for hot channel (7) and the hanger (8) will be deactivated, tightness pressure (9) will be activated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251680.png)

**Step 6**

Pressing

The pressing pressure (11) will be activated, and the reference cylinder (10) will be deactivated.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000251681.png)

### Connection - Set

Equipment Status

Program Step

Special Equipment

Measuring Instrument, TP No. 1567930-0101

Consumables

Loctite 243 TP No. 344431-0000

If the run-out tolerance is more than the recommended it can affect the bearing installation and the sealings in the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-CC5C58A6) with a water leakage as a result. Therefore it is advisable to aim for a run-out as low as possible.

If the run-out tolerance is more than recommended, do as follows:

3.  Increase the torque on one or more of the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E239F879), meanwhile check the measuring instrument if the run-out tolerance is affected.
    
    Nominal torque is **22 Nm**, not more than **25 Nm** is recommended.
    
4.  If this does not work, loosen all the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E239F879) and tighten them with different torque until the run-out tolerance is as low as possible.
    
    This technique can lead to a torque for one or more of the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E239F879) to be beneath **22 Nm**, secure those [Screw](#Screwscrews-E239F879) with **Loctite 243**.

### Swivel/Connection - Set Lid Blower

Equipment Status

Program Step

Special Equipment

Sliding Caliper

#### Lid Blower Set

1.  Adjust the [Holder](#Holderholder-E23B272F) on the [Swivel](#Swivelswivel-E23B0663) to the distance **A**, tighten the [Counter Nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E23B0CC8).
    
2.  Adjust the [Plunge](#Plungeplunge-E23B13A4) on the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E23B1E62) so that the distance **B** is obtained, tighten the [Counter Nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E23B332F).
    
    **Note:** The [Plunge](#Plungeplunge-E23B13A4) shall be in its inner position, see arrow in illustration.
    
3.  Fit the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E23B1E62) (with the [Plunge](#Plungeplunge-E23B13A4)) in the [Holder](#Holderholder-E23B272F), assemble the [Washer](#Washerwasher-E23B3A96) and the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-E23B43F2).
    
4.  Adjust to the distance **D**, tighten the [Counter Nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E23B4B7F).
    
    The above settings are done to achieve gap **C**, so that the [Mandrel Wheel](#MandrelWheelmandrelWheel-E23B528A) goes free from the [Plunge](#Plungeplunge-E23B13A4) during rotation.
    

5.  Align the air hoses so that they are pointing downwards.
    
    **Note:** Slide the plunge backward and forward to its end position and check so that [Washer](#Washerwasher-E23B3A96) not strikes [Holder](#Holderholder-E23B272F)!
    
6.  Fit the air hoses to the [Lid Blower](#LidBlowerlidBlower-E23AFF96).
    
    **Note:** Make sure that no sideway forces are added. Sideway forces increase the wear on the [Washer](#Washerwasher-E23B3A96).

### Swivel/Connection - Fit

Equipment Status

Program Step STEP ZERO

Consumables

Grease: TP No. 344407-0000

1.  Assemble the [Pipe](#Pipepipe-E252C877).
    
2.  Assemble the [Tube](#Tubetubes-E252D937) in the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-E252DFB9).
    
3.  Slide the [Ring](#Ringring-E252EF05) and the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-E252DFB9) on to the mandrel.
    
    **Note:** During this assembling, make sure that the [Tube](#Tubetubes-E252D937) are aligned and fitted between the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-E252DFB9) and the mandrel.
    
4.  Assemble the [Washer](#Washerwashers-E252FBEA) and the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E25304EB). Tighten crosswise in steps to a final torque of **22 Nm**.
    
    **Note:** It is important that the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-E252DFB9) is carefully aligned to the mandrel shaft, otherwise a future water-leakage can occur. If there is a need for check, see .
    
5.  Make sure that the [Bracket](#Bracketbracket-E2530EA8) is correctly aligned against the [Swivel](#Swivelswivel-E2531797), by checking that the distances **A** and **B** are the same.
    
6.  If necessary, loosen the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E2531F93) and adjust the distances. Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E2531F93).
    
7.  Apply a thin layer of grease on the [Connection](#Connectionconnection-E252DFB9) and slide on the [Swivel](#Swivelswivel-E2531797). Align the [Bracket](#Bracketbracket-E2530EA8) in to the [Pin](#Pinpin-E25347B7).
    
8.  Assemble the [Washer](#Washerwashers-E2534FEE) and the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E2535EE7). Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E2535EE7) crosswise.
    

9.  Assemble the [Water Hose](#WaterHosewaterHoses-E25367FE) and the [Air Hose](#AirHoseairHoses-E2536F02).
    
10.  If there is need for adjusting the lid blower, see Procedure [Swivel/Connection - Set Lid Blower](#section768).
    
11.  Put the cooling water hoses back for the **LFU** (15).

#### Assemble Holders

**Note:** The tool [Holder](#HolderHolder-E3DA6080) are manufactured and marked in pairs. Do not mix them with other tool holders.

1.  Make sure that the surface of the [Carriage](#CarriageCarriage-E3DA57FA) (see illustration below), on the [Linear Guide](#LinearGuidelinearGuides-E3DAA29B), is pointing upwards.
    
2.  Assemble the [Linear Guide](#LinearGuidelinearGuides-E3DAA29B). Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E3DAB78A) and [Screw](#Screwscrews-E3DABD1F) to **30 Nm**.
    
3.  Connect the grease hoses for the lubricating of the [Linear Guide](#LinearGuidelinearGuides-E3DAA29B).

4.  Assemble the [Holder](#HolderHolder-E3DA6080) and [Screw](#ScrewScrew-E3DA5CFF).
    
    **Note:** Do not tighten the [Screw](#ScrewScrew-E3DA5CFF).

    **Note:** The [Holder](#HolderHolder-E3DA6080) must touch each other, not the [Carriage](#CarriageCarriage-E3DA57FA).
    
8.  Fix the [Holder](#HolderHolder-E3DA6080) against each other, make sure that the [Carriage](#CarriageCarriage-E3DA57FA) **are not** touching each other. If necessary, press the [Carriage](#CarriageCarriage-E3DA57FA) apart.
    
    **Note:** The [Screw](#ScrewScrew-E3DA5CFF) have different heights of the head. The screws with a normal head are for the holes with a longer countersink.
    
9.  Tighten the [Screw](#ScrewScrew-E3DA5CFF) to **22 Nm**.
    
10.  Remove the [Screw M8](#ScrewM8screws-E3DADE96) and [Washer](#Washerwashers-E3DAE899).

1.  Put the [Reference stop](#ReferenceStopreferenceStop-EF3915CF) in a vice.
    
2.  Loosen the [Reference cylinder](#ReferenceCylinderreferenceCylinder-EF3915CF) with the [Key](#Keykey-EF3915CF).
    
3.  Remove the [O-ring](#O-ringO-ring-EF3915CF) from the [Reference cylinder](#ReferenceCylinderreferenceCylinder-EF3915CF).
    
4.  Change the [Reference cylinder](#ReferenceCylinderreferenceCylinder-EF3915CF).
    
5.  Reset the [Insert](#Insertinsert-EF5EADFF) to the initial length **A**.
    
    **Note:** Put the [Insert](#Insertinsert-EF5EADFF) into a vice or a ½ inch socket. Use a drift punch and gently tap the inner part out of the outer sleeve.
    
6.  Assemble a new [O-ring](#O-ringO-ring-EF3915CF).
    
7.  Apply **Threadlocker** on the [Thread](#Threadthreads-EF3915CF) of the [Reference cylinder](#ReferenceCylinderreferenceCylinder-EF3915CF).
    
    **Note:** Avoid Threadlocker in the O-ring area.
    
8.  Install the new [Reference cylinder](#ReferenceCylinderreferenceCylinder-EF3915CF) in the [Reference stop](#ReferenceStopreferenceStop-EF3915CF).
    
9.  Tighten the [Reference cylinder](#ReferenceCylinderreferenceCylinder-EF3915CF) to **75 ±25 Nm** with the [Key](#Keykey-EF3915CF).

### Hot Channel - Basic Set of Plastic Dosing

Equipment Status

Program Step STEP ZERO

Burn hazard.

Allow the hot channel to cool down before starting any work on it.

The hot channel and its connections can be hot.

#### Foreword

The setting of the right amount of plastic is done in two steps: Basic Set and Final Set. See [Hot Channel - Final Set of Plastic Dosing](#section804).

Basic Set only gives a rough setting of the plastic amount and it must be followed by a Final Set.

#### Basic Set of the Plastic Dose

1.  Loosen the [Nut](#Nutnut-E464BDE5), and adjust the [Stop Screw](#StopScrewstopScrew-E46497E8) to the distance **A,** according to the table.
    
2.  Tighten the [Nut](#Nutnut-E464BDE5).
    
    **Note:** If the [Stop Screw](#StopScrewstopScrew-E46497E8) should be moved inwards, do as follows:
    
    *   Empty the injection cylinders plastic chamber. See Procedure [Hot Channel - Final Set of Plastic Dosing](#section804).
        
        Distance
        
        A (mm)
        
        **Base**
        
        50
        
        **Midi**
        
        45
        
        **Mini**
        
        40
        
        **Micro**
        
        30

*   Piston

#### Set Proximity Plate

1.  Loosen the [Screw](#Screwscrew-E464CB5A).
    
2.  Make sure that the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-E4C9B3DC) presses against the [Stop Screw](#StopScrewstopScrew-E4CF0355).
    
3.  Push and align the [Plate](#Plateplate-E4CF091B) toward the [Screw](#Screwscrew-E4CF0D64) and tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrew-E464CB5A).
    
4.  Adjust the [Proximity Switch](#ProximitySwitchproximitySwitch-E4CF1737) to the distance **B**.
    
5.  Measure the distance **C** between the [Bracket](#Bracketbracket-E4CF1CB6) and the tongue on the [Plate](#Plateplate-E4CF2374).
    
6.  Calculate as follows: **C - 1.8mm = D**
    
7.  Adjust the [Proximity Switch](#ProximitySwitchproximitySwitch-E4CF2804) to the distance **D ±0.2 mm**.
    

**Final Set**

Perform a final setting of the plastic dose. See Procedure [Hot Channel - Final Set of Plastic Dosing](#section804).

### Hot Channel - Final Set of Plastic Dosing

Equipment Status

Program Step

1.  Produce 4 packages from each hot channel and measure the lid thickness according to OM Package Checks.
    
2.  Turn the service key to ON and then to off.
    
3.  The [Button for Emptying Injection Cylinders](#ButtonForEmptyInjectionCylindersbut-E4D1288C) for emptying the injection cylinders will appear in the [Manoeuvre Window](#ManoeuvreWindowmanoeuvreWindow-E4D12351).
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000603807.png)

*   Manoeuvre Window
*   Button for Emptying Injection Cylinders

4.  When the [Button for Emptying Injection Cylinders](#ButtonForEmptyInjectionCylindersbut-E4D1288C) has been pressed, the button will turn to blue, and the [Button for 1/0 the Emptying Sequence](#ButtonFor10TheEmptyingSequencebutto-E4D13F50) will appear.
    
    A help text `Empty InjCyl before dosing adjustment`, will also be displayed.
    
5.  Activate the 1/0 button, and step the machine up to PRODUCTION.
    
    The machine will feed two blanks into the conveyor, then empty the injection cylinders and make two lids. After this, the injection cylinders **will not** be refilled.
    
    The machine will automatically step down to TANK FILLING. Then it will be possible to adjust the dosing amount. See following instruction.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000603806.png)

*   Manoeuvre Window
*   Button for Emptying Injection Cylinders
*   Button for 1/0 the Emptying Sequence

6.  Open the doors and adjust the [Stop Screw](#StopScrewstopScrew-E4D16802) on the [Injection Cylinder](#InjectionCylinderinjectionCylinders-E4D16EB6) by loosening the [Counter Nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E4D1734C).
    
    **Note:** By moving the stop screw outwards, the plastic dose will be increased.
    
    **Note:** It is possible that a small amount of oil will leak from the [Counter Nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E4D1734C) due to the release of tension. This is normal as the counter nut is also a sealing.
    

7.  Tighten the [Counter Nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E4D1734C).
    
8.  Set the proximity switch. See Procedure [Hot Channel - Basic Set of Plastic Dosing](#section803).
    
9.  Remove the packages from the mandrels.
    
10.  Close the doors and step the machine up to PRODUCTION.
    
    The machine is now in normal mode. If it is necessary to perform more adjustments, repeat from the beginning of this instruction.

2.  Remove the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E07C4936).

#### Reassemble

**Note:** The [Bushing](#Bushingbushing-E084E048) and the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E08518A5) have matched tolerances and must always be changed together.

Burn hazard.

Handle the hot channel and its parts with caution.

The hot channel and its connections are hot.

1.  Make sure that all parts of the hot channel are clean and free from plastic residue.
    
2.  Apply a layer of Loctite 8014: TP No. 344443-0907 on the [Bushing](#Bushingbushing-E084E048).
    
3.  Install a new [Plastic ring](#PlasticRingplasticRing-E084F1ED) on the [Bushing](#Bushingbushing-E084E048).
    
    **Note:** To avoid plastic leakage inside the hole for the bushing, place the Hot Channel with the bushing hole upwards.
    
4.  Heat up until the plastic inside the hot channel start to melt.
    
5.  Install the [Bushing](#Bushingbushing-E084E048).
    
6.  Install the [Flange](#Flangeflange-E0850040).
    
7.  Lubricate the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E0850A1E) with Klüberpaste: TP No. 344418-0319.
    
    **Note:** If Klüberpaste is not applied to the screws there is a large risk that the threads will seize causing irreparable damage to the hot channel.
    
8.  Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E0850A1E) to a torque between 3Nm and 3.5Nm.
    
9.  Lubricate the contact surface **A** of the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E08518A5) with Loctite 8014: TP No. 344443-0907.

### Hot Channel - Change Needle

Equipment Status

Program Step HEATING

Consumables

Anti-seize Loctite 8014: TP No. 344443-0907

#### Preparation

1.  If the inner hot channel’s needle must be changed, pull out the **LFU**. See Procedure [LFU - Move to Service Position](#section744).
    
    The outer hot channel’s needle can be changed without pulling out the **LFU** from the machine.
    
2.  Activate the service key and step the machine up to heating.
    

#### Change Needle

Hazardous noise.

Wear hearing protection before disconnecting the [Air Hose](#AirHoseairHoses-E4E2B761).

The air pressure is permanently on in the [Air Hose](#AirHoseairHoses-E4E2B761).

2.  Remove the [Air Hose](#AirHoseairHoses-E4E2B761) that is connected to the side where the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D) will be changed. Plug the air hose.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000196281.png)

*   Air Hose

2.  Remove the [Attachment pipe](#AttachmentPipeattachmentPipe-E4E2EEEB).
    
3.  Loosen the [Counter nut](#CounterNutcounterNut-E4E2F9C4) and turn the [Screw](#Screwscrew-E4E302DA) downwards so that the pre-tension on the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D) is lost.
    
4.  Remove the [Screws](#Screwsscrews-E4E30E2E) and bring out the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E4E32117).
    
5.  Burn hazard.
    
    Allow the hot channel to cool down before touching the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D).
    
    The hot channel and its connections can be hot.
    
    Remove the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D).
    

#### Reassemble

1.  Lubricate the contact surface **A** of the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D) with Loctite 8014: TP No. 344443-0907, and fit the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D).
    
2.  Assemble the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E4E32117), and tighten the [Screws](#Screwsscrews-E4E30E2E).
    
3.  Assemble the [Attachment pipe](#AttachmentPipeattachmentPipe-E4E2EEEB) and the air hose.
    
4.  Set the [Needle](#Needleneedle-E4E2C46D). See Procedure [Hot Channel - Set Needle](#section802).
    
5.  Deactivate the service key (heating will be lost).
    
6.  Fit the **LFU**. See Procedure [LFU - Install from Service Position](#section746).

    **Note:** Make sure that the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-A3C45169) reaches the bottom of the hot channel and is correctly mounted, with the [Plastic ring](#TeflonRingteflonRing-A3C45A5A) properly attached. If this is not done, or if the ring is missing, the screws will break.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002960938.png)

*   Cylinder
*   Plastic ring

**Compress Plastic Ring**

**Note:** The instructions below must be followed, or the screws will break after running the machine for a short time.

7.  Make sure that the threads in the hot channel are clean.
    
8.  Make sure that the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB) is free from plastic residue.
    
9.  Place the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB) on the hot channel. Make sure that the recessed side of the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB) is facing the hot channel.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002940468.png)

*   Flange

**Note:** The instructions below must be followed, or the screws will break after running the machine for a short time.

9.  Use new [Screw](#Screwscrews-A3C2A884). Lubricate the [Screw](#Screwscrews-A3C2A884) with Klüberpaste: TP No. 344418-0319.
    
    **Note:** If Klüberpaste is not applied to the screws there is a large risk that the threads will seize causing irreparable damage to the hot channel.
    
10.  Tighten the screws crosswise by hand.
    
11.  Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-A3C2A884) crosswise, in small steps, to 4 Nm to compress the [Plastic ring](#TeflonRingteflonRing-A3C45A5A).
    
12.  Unscrew the [Screw](#Screwscrews-A3C2A884), and remove them completely.
    
    **Note:** Make sure that the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-A3C45169) does not move. This may cause the [Plastic ring](#TeflonRingteflonRing-A3C45A5A) to move from its position.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002940467.png)

*   Screw
*   Cylinder
*   Plastic ring

**Tightening Sequence**

13.  For the machine to work properly without breakdowns, the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB) must be parallel to the [Hot channel](#HotChannelhotChannel-57692F56) when tightening the [Screw](#Screwscrews-A3C2A884). A must be equal to B, see the following illustration.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002946468.png)

*   Flange
*   Hot channel

**Note:** The instructions below must be followed, or the screws will break after running the machine for a short time.

14.  Press the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB) against the hot channel with your fingers to make the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB) parallel to the hot channel. Simultaneously install the screws, and turn them with your fingers until they make contact with the [Flange](#Flangeflange-A3C430BB).
    
15.  Use a marker pen to write numbers on the hot channel. See the following illustration.
    

In the following tightening sequence, the screws must rotate in the final step, when tightening to 11 Nm. If the screws do not rotate when tightening to 11 Nm, restart the process, see item [Reference](RemoveTheCompletely.-546FE632).

16.  Tighten the screws to 4 Nm in the following pattern: 12, 6, 3, 9.
    
17.  Tighten the screws to 8 Nm in the following pattern: 6, 12, 9, 3.
    
18.  Tighten the screw to 11 Nm in the following pattern: 12, 6, 3, 9.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002930213.png)

Risk of damage to the equipment.

Take care to not damage the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59).

The [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59) can slide out of the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-A3C45169) and become damaged.

19.  Make sure that there is no dirt or dust on the surface of the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59).
    
20.  Lubricate the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59) with Loctite 8014: TP No. 344443-0907.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002930211.png)

*   Piston

20.  Install the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59) in the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-A3C45169) so that the hole in the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59) is facing the hot channel.
    
    **Note:** The [Piston](#Pistonpiston-A3C44D59) and the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-A3C45169) have matching tolerances and must always be changed together.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002946469.png)

*   Piston
*   Cylinder

21.  Apply a thin layer of Loctite 8014: TP No. 344443-0907, to the narrow diameter on the [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-A3C45169).
    
22.  Install the [Cooling body](#CoolingBodycoolingBody-A3C26829).
    
    **Note:** Check that the interior of the [Cooling body](#CoolingBodycoolingBody-A3C26829) is free from dirt.
    
    **Note:** Make sure not to damage the o-rings in the [Cooling body](#CoolingBodycoolingBody-A3C26829).
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002930206.png)

*   Cooling body
*   Cylinder

#### Hot Channel - Bench Assemble

1.  Put the [Hot channel](#HotChannelhotChannel-E08AA0F6) in a vice.
    
2.  Apply Klüberpaste: TP No. 344418-0319, on the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E08AA523).
    
    **Note:** If Klüberpaste is not applied to the screws there is a large risk that the threads will seize causing irreparable damage to the hot channel.

#### Handle Remote Control

Risk of injury

Be careful when working near the shims.

The shims in the LFU could be sharp.

Risk of Personal Injury.

The service key must only be used, and the valves must only be forced by trained service personal. Otherwise is there a risk for personal injuries due to lack of competence.

Risk of crushing and cutting.

Enclose the area around the **LFU** and make sure that no unauthorised personnel can come in contact with the **LFU**.

The movement in the **LFU** can cause injuries.

Instruction regarding handle of the remote control and recharging accumulator, see [LFU Remote Control - Handle](#section748).

5.  Make sure that the mandrel wheel and external tools do not collide with each other.
    
6.  Insert the service key and activate step 1 (Hydraulic high Pressure).
    
7.  Activate step 2 (Lock), close tools with the recharge accumulator valve, and activate step 3 (Horizontal force).
    

4.  Fit the [Template, TP No 2799379](#TemplateTPNo2799379template-E5577099), and step down to step 1.
    
    The external tools will now stop against the [Holder](#Holderholders-E557769D), this operation makes it further on possible to lower the [Support](#Supportsupport-E5577CBC) and [Support](#Supportsupport-E5578195).
    
    **Note:** If the hydraulic pressure drops to 0 bars in the same way as if an emergency stop button is activated, or the hydraulic oil temperature reaches its alarm level, or power failure on the machine etc. the external tools will open without warning.
    
5.  Shut down the hydraulic unit, by stepping down from step 1 (Hydraulic high Pressure) and leave the “Service functions ” window.
    
6.  Remove the belt cover. See [Motor Unit - Remove Cover](#section848).

#### Foreword

The overhaul instruction for the hot channel guide, is separated in the following instructions:

It is advisable to do them in this order, to get the right flow in the work.

#### Overhaul Air Cylinder

1.  Unload the air [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E564CEB0), see Procedure [Hot Channel - Set Needle](#section802) on page [Hot Channel - Set Needle](#section802).
    
2.  Remove the [Attachment Pipe](#AttachmentPipeattachmentPipe-E564E1DF).
    
3.  Remove the air [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E564CEB0).
    
4.  Take out the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-E564EC28) and the [Spring](#Springspring-E564FF86).
    
5.  Remove the [Scraper](#Scraperscraper-E564F663) and the [Sealing](#Sealingsealing-E56504E7).
    
    **Note:** Take care of the [Washer](#Washerwasher-E5650F6A) and the damper (6).
    
6.  Fit the new [Scraper](#Scraperscraper-E564F663) and [Sealing](#Sealingsealing-E56504E7). Use the [Sleeve](#Sleevesleeve-E5651788) to install the scraper. It is recommended that you use a lever press.
    
    **Note:** See the illustration, for the right directions.
    
7.  Assemble the [Damper](#Damperdamper-E5651EE6) and the [Washer](#Washerwasher-E5650F6A).
    
8.  Assemble the [Spring](#Springspring-E564FF86) and the [Piston](#Pistonpiston-E564EC28).
    

#### Final assembly

**Note:** Final assembly, should be done after that the overhaul is performed on the hot channel.

2.  Fit the air [Cylinder](#Cylindercylinder-E564CEB0) in its origin place, assemble and tighten the screws.
    
3.  Apply **thread sealant** on the [Attachment Pipe](#AttachmentPipeattachmentPipe-E564E1DF), fit and tighten it.
    
4.  Set the pretension on the needle. See Procedure [Hot Channel - Set Needle](#section802) on page [Hot Channel - Set Needle](#section802).

Transfer Unit
-------------

### Description

The extruder motor runs at two different speeds determined by the level of plastic in the plastic accumulator. The level is supervised by the [Inductive sensor (upper)](#InductiveSensorupperinductiveSensor-E5D7A990) and the [Inductive sensor (lower)](#InductiveSensorlowerinductiveSensor-E5D7AF84).

When the **LFU** is running continuously the extruder motor is supposed to run mainly in low speed mode, occasionally changing to high speed mode (every second or third injection).

Problems with the extruder motor will be indicated by a common alarm, displayed as “`F/C FEEDER MOTOR OVERLOAD`” on the **TPOP** panel. This alarm can be the result of mechanical and/or electrical overload, as well as if the extruder motor has been running continuously at high speed for more than 30 seconds. The latter is to indicate a blocked or limited granulate flow into the extruder or a leakage of plastic after the extruder.

If the "low" speed of the extruder is set too high, the extruder will not switch to "high" speed as intended. Then there is a risk that the alarm "`F/C FEEDER MOTOR OVERLOAD`" will not be set if a heated hose breaks.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000398281.png)

*   Plastic accumulator
*   Inductive sensor (upper)
*   Inductive sensor (lower)

If the [Plastic accumulator](#PlasticAccumulatorPlasticAccumulato-E5D7C6DD) hits the mechanical stop when it is filled, and the extruder does not stop in time, a high pressure peak can be created in the heated hose.

The pictures below show the three different stages of the [Plastic accumulator](#PlasticAccumulatorPlasticAccumulato-E5D7C6DD) function.

**(A)** The [Plastic accumulator](#PlasticAccumulatorPlasticAccumulato-E5D7C6DD) is full. The [Inductive sensor (upper)](#InductiveSensorupperinductiveSensor-E5D7A990) and [Inductive sensor (lower)](#InductiveSensorlowerinductiveSensor-E5D7AF84) are both activated and stops the extruder motor. No plastic is fed to the plastic accumulator.

**(B)** One [Inductive sensor (upper)](#InductiveSensorupperinductiveSensor-E5D7A990) (the upper sensor), is activated and sets the low speed to the extruder motor. Plastic is continuously fed to the plastic accumulator.

**(C)** The [Plastic accumulator](#PlasticAccumulatorPlasticAccumulato-E5D7C6DD) is empty. None of the sensors are activated. This sets high speed to the extruder motor. Plastic is fed up to the [Plastic accumulator](#PlasticAccumulatorPlasticAccumulato-E5D7C6DD).

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000398280.png)

*   Plastic accumulator
*   Inductive sensor (upper)
*   Inductive sensor (lower)

### Transfer Unit - Set Frequency

Equipment Status

Program Step Production

#### Check

For more information about the transfer unit, see [Description](#section824) on page [Description](#section824).

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0000398279.png)

*   Plastic accumulator
*   Inductive sensor (upper)
*   Inductive sensor (lower)

#### Set low speed

Fine adjustments must be performed for every individual unit. See section [Settings](#section922) on page [Settings](#section922) for basic setting values.

When the frequency for low speed is set correctly, the extruder motor works mainly in low speed mode and occasionally change to high speed mode (not to stop). The ideal setting is if the motor works continuously at low speed without interruptions.

*   Step the machine up to production.
    
*   Make sure that the two sensors are not activated. If they are, the extruder works with an over capacity and regulates between low speed and stop, which causes unnecessary high stress on the motor and gearbox.
    
*   If necessary, decrease the frequency for low speed.
    

#### Set high speed

The frequency for high speed mode must be approximately 20% higher than the low speed frequency. The setting of the high speed is most critical the first time, after the machine has been stepped down to out of heating.

*   Step the machine up to production.
    
*   Observe the accumulator and the sensors during the first ten **LFU** cycles. If the accumulator at any time reaches the upper mechanical stop (the plastic accumulator is empty), the frequency for high speed must be increased.
    
*   If necessary, increase the frequency for high speed.

Drive Tool
----------

### Description

The [Servo motor](#ServoMotorservoMotor-E767F23E) handles the opening and closing of the external tools together with the vertical force cylinder.

The [Servo motor](#ServoMotorservoMotor-E767F23E) drives a [Belt](#Beltbelt-E76812B7) that is connected to a [Shaft](#Shaftshaft-E76818D7). The [Shaft](#Shaftshaft-E76818D7) has [Toothed pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulleys-E768212D) where the [Timing belt](#TimingBelttimingBelts-E7685B69) are attached.

The pivot point of the [Link arm](#LinkArmlinkArms-E7686477) creates the movement pattern of the external tools.

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0002561215.png)

*   Servo motor
*   Belt
*   Shaft

### Drive Tool - Set Belt Tension

Equipment Status

Program Step

Special Equipment

Dynamometer, TP No. 74767 or alternatively a Belt Tension Meter, TP No. 90459-2181

#### Check belt tension

1.  Remove the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E76A302E), the [Screw](#Screwscrews-71396A6D), and the two belt [Holder](#Holderholders-E76A407B).
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004743054.png)

*   Screw
*   Holder
*   Screw

2.  Check the belt tension:
    
    *   With a [Dynamometer](#Dynamometerdynamometer-E76A45E7): Press at the centre of the belt with a force of **50 N**. The distance between the belt surfaces should be according to distance **A**.
        
    *   With a [Belt tension meter](#BeltTensionMeterbeltTensionMeter-E76A4CFF): a frequency of **60 ±2 Hz**.
        

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004743053.png)

A (mm) = 55 ±1

*   Dynamometer
*   Belt tension meter

#### Set belt tension

1.  Remove the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E76A70A1).
    
2.  Set the belt tension by tightening the [Screw](#AdjustScrewscrews-E76A79D3).
    
3.  Check the belt tension during the setting. See Procedure [Check belt tension](#CheckBeltTension-714168FB)
    
4.  Fit and tighten [Screw](#Screwscrews-E76A70A1) with a torque of **22 ±2 Nm**.
    

![Illustration](https://stsp3lqew6l65ci.blob.core.windows.net/illustrations/0004743052.png)

A (mm) = 55 ±1

*   Screw
*   Screw

5.  Assemble the [Holder](#Holderholders-E76A407B) and tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E76A302E) and the [Screw](#Screwscrews-71396A6D) gently. Make sure that the [Mounting lug](#MountingLugmountingLug-E76ABD02) is aligned with the [Frame piece](#FramePieceframePiece-E76AC59D).
    
    **Note:** If the [Mounting lug](#MountingLugmountingLug-E76ABD02) and the [Frame piece](#FramePieceframePiece-E76AC59D) are not aligned, the belt tension will differ between the outside and the inside of the belt.
    
6.  Install the belt cover.
    
7.  Step the machine up to program step heating.
    
8.  Use the remote control, see Procedure[LFU Remote Control - Handle](#section748) and activate:
    
    *   Step 3 Horizontal Force
        
9.  To centre the tool beams, loosen the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E76A302E) and the [Screw](#Screwscrews-71396A6D), then tighten them right back.

1.  Assemble the holder and connect it to the hot channel, see Procedure [Guide Hot Channel - Overhaul](#section820).

3.  Fit the [Ball bearing](#BallBearingballBearing-E7EAAE3D) on to the [Shaft](#Shaftshaft-E7EACCD9).

6.  Fit the [Retaining ring](#RetainingRingretainingRing-E7EB1EB4), [Ball bearing](#BallBearingballBearing-E7EB28CB), [Ring](#Ringring-E7EB39DE), and [Bearing](#Bearingbearing-E7EB4207) into the [Bearing house](#BearingHousebearingHouse-E7EB4E11). If needed, warm up the bearing house by a hot air-gun.
    
7.  Warm up the [Bearing house](#BearingHousebearingHouse-E7EAE6E3) with a hot-air gun. Use the [Puller TP No. 1573950](#PullerTPNo.1573950puller-E7EB5449) and press the [Shaft](#Shaftshaft-E7EACCD9) through the [Bearing](#Bearingbearing-E7EB4207), [Ball bearing](#BallBearingballBearing-E7EB28CB) and the [Bearing house](#BearingHousebearingHouse-E7EAE6E3). The [Ring](#Ringring-E7EB39DE) must be lifted up.
    
8.  Fit the [Retaining ring](#RetainingRingretainingRings-E7EB5E55).
    
9.  Fit the [Toothed Pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulley-E7EB0447) and align according to illustration below, tighten with **22 Nm**.
    
    **Note:** It is important that the screw and the slots in the [Toothed pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulley-E7EAF1E3) and [Toothed Pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulley-E7EB0447) are aligned as illustration shows, otherwise there will be a rapid wear in the belts!
    

10.  Fit a 0.5 mm feeler gauge between the [Toothed pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulley-E7EAF1E3) and the [Bearing house](#BearingHousebearingHouse-E7EB4E11). Tighten the screws to the [Toothed pulley](#ToothedPulleytoothedPulley-E7EAF1E3) to a torque of **9.3 Nm**.

8.  Fit and tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E800D92E) in the motor flange.
    
9.  Tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrew-E7FF5F5F) to a torque of **40 Nm**.
    
10.  Loosen and then tighten the [Screw](#Screwscrews-E800D92E) again.

Tool - Common
